CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 1, 1954, pg. 1 reads: "GPIL Probes Heagy-Spalding Records - The Greater Pittsburgh Improvement League and Atty. Richard F. Jones, president of the Pittsburgh Branch of the NAACP, are shown as they went over the files on the Heagy-Spalding deaths with Joseph Flynn, captain of the city Homicide Bureau, last Wednesday. Left to right: Manford Sales of the GPIL; Atty. Henry Smith, GPIL counsel; Captain Flynn, Attorney Jones of the NAACP and Atty. George Shields, member of the GPIL committee. - Harris Photo."image published by Pittsburgh Courier with unknown man standing on right masked.
TitMainTitle: Group of six men, from left: Atty. Henry R. Smith, Manford Sales, Captain Joseph Flynn, Atty. Richard F. Jones, unknown man, standing; and Atty. George Shields, gathered in office interior during Heagy-Spaulding case
